snippet: American officials think Robert Levinson, who disappeared in Iran in 2007, is still alive and captive, but Iranian officials say they know nothing about him.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation offers a $1 million reward for information about former FBI agent Robert Levinson, who disappeared in Iran in 2007; American officials think Levinson is still alive and captive, but Iranian officials deny any knowledge of his whereabouts.
lead_paragraph: American officials think Robert Levinson, who disappeared in Iran in 2007, is still alive and captive, but Iranian officials say they know nothing about him.

headline.seo: F.B.I. Offers Reward for News of Ex-Agent Levinson
headline.main: F.B.I. Offers Reward for News of Former Agent Missing in Iran
headline.print_headline: Iran: F.B.I. Offers Reward for News Of Former Agent Missing in Iran
